title: NumPy Dataset: Normalize Scores
story: Normalization (z-score standardization) transforms data to have mean 0 and standard deviation 1. Essential for machine learning!
instructions: Use the scores dataset. Normalize using formula: (scores - mean) / std. Print the normalized array rounded to 2 decimals.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Dataset: test scores
scores = np.array([85, 90, 78, 92, 88, 76, 95, 89])

# Normalize: (x - mean) / std
mean = scores.mean()
std = scores.std()
normalized = (scores - mean) / std
print(np.round(normalized, 2))
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

scores = np.array([85, 90, 78, 92, 88, 76, 95, 89])
mean = scores.mean()
std = scores.std()
normalized = (scores - mean) / std
print(np.round(normalized, 2))

hints.text: Calculate mean and std first, then apply formula to entire array.
Broadcasting handles (scores - mean) and division automatically!
